The International Atomic Energy Agency: IAEA) quarterly reports: The IAEA is considered the authoritative view of Iran's compliance with the nuclear deal. Their reports consistently found Iran to be in compliance with the terms of the agreement.
Certification by the U: S. State Department: The State Department is required to report to Congress every 90 days on Iran's compliance. In April, they certified that Iran is living up to its end of the deal.
Expert opinions: Various experts interviewed agreed that Iran is complying with the nuclear pact. These experts provide additional verification of Iran's adherence to the terms of the agreement.
